sense.name: Make a map of; show or establish the features or details of; explore or survey for the purposes of making a map.
sense.examples: NASA is making new efforts to map the surface of Venus. We haven't even begun to map the many galaxies that we know exist. Historians attempt to map the literature of early Europe.

sense.name: Plan, delineate, or arrange in detail.
sense.commentary: INCLUDES: MAP OUT Syntax Is: NP1[agent] MAP NP2[patient]
sense.examples: They mapped out a strategy in several phrases. Tokyo administrators hired a firm to design a computer program to map its new waterworks.

sense.name: Locate within a specific region of a chromosome in relation to known DNA or gene sequences.
sense.examples: Scientists are mapping the human genome.

sense.name: Depict as if on a map.
sense.examples: Sorrow was mapped on the mother's face.

sense.name: To establish a mapping (of mathematical elements or sets); make a set of one to one correspondences.
sense.examples: John mapped reference frames in language onto those mental models. Can infants map meaning onto newly segmented words? How is a two dimensional matrix mapped onto a linear array?
